Hi Mark,

Thanks for your note regarding our upcoming financial-strategy refresh. I’ve pulled together the most recent insights from our internal Notion workspace and combined them with current market data:

1. Market momentum to leverage
   • Q1 analysis shows robust demand in cloud computing (revenue +7.4 % YoY, margins expanding).  
   • Tech-infrastructure multiples (EV/Sales 5–7×) still look attractive versus long-term averages.
   • Recommendation: Step-up exposure to hyperscalers (AWS, Azure) and pick two niche SaaS infrastructure plays for a satellite position (4 % of portfolio each).

2. Deployment schedule & liquidity
   • Stage entries over the next 10 weeks to smooth price risk; keep ≥15 % of assets in short-duration treasuries so we have dry powder for opportunistic buys.

3. Risk and credit considerations
   • We ran our new econometric stress-test model (see “Credit Analysis Techniques” page): if rates pop +300 bps, VaR stays <4 % provided single-name exposure is capped at 8 % and duration <3.3 yrs.
   • Securing a revolving credit facility now (SOFR + 150 bps, 3-yr tenor) will let us fund tuck-in acquisitions or share buy-backs at short notice.

4. Governance checkpoints
   • Update investment policy statement to reflect the new 8 % single-name ceiling and monthly VaR reporting.  
   • Add quarterly portfolio-wide stress-tests tied to macro scenarios (rate shock, cyclical downturn, stagflation).

5. Next actions
   • I’ll draft a detailed playbook with position-sizing tables and KPI dashboards by Monday COB.  
   • Let’s review together on a quick 30-min call Tuesday at 9:30 a.m. PT—let me know if that works.

Looking forward to tightening up the strategy and capturing these tailwinds.

Best,
[Your Name]
